com.b2international.commons.concurrent

Class ConcurrentCollectionUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.b2international.commons.concurrent.ConcurrentCollectionUtils

  • public class ConcurrentCollectionUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Collection of collection related concurrent utility methods.

    • Method Detail

      • filter

        public static <T> java.util.Iterator<T> filter(java.util.Iterator<T> sourceIterator,
                                               com.google.common.base.Predicate<T> predicate)
        Applies the specified predicate concurrently to each item of the source iterator, retaining the original order of the elements. The underlying Iterator implementation reads ahead in the source iterator and distributes the task of evaluating the predicate to a thread pool, therefore the specified predicate must be thread safe.
        Type Parameters:
        T -
        Parameters:
        sourceIterator - the unfiltered iterator to use
        predicate - the predicate to use as a filter
        Returns:
        the filtered iterator

      • transform

        public static <F,T> java.util.Iterator<T> transform(java.util.Iterator<F> sourceIterator,
                                                    com.google.common.base.Function<F,T> function)
        Applies the specified function concurrently to each item of the source iterator, retaining the original order of the elements. The underlying Iterator implementation reads ahead in the source iterator and distributes the task of evaluating the predicate to a thread pool, therefore the specified function must be thread safe.
        Type Parameters:
        T -
        Parameters:
        sourceIterator - the source iterator to use
        function - the function to use
        Returns:
        the iterator with transformed elements

      • forEach

        public static <T> void forEach(java.lang.Iterable<? extends T> subjects,
                               Procedure<? super T> closure)
        Concurrently applies the closure on each element of the given iterable. This method returns to the caller when the given closure is applied to all element, till then synchronously blocks. The number of executor threads is specified via Runtime.availableProcessors().

        Calling this method is similar to GPars' execution 

         GParsPool.withPool $availableProcessoros, { it ->
     //custom logic would go there
 }
        Parameters:
        subjects - the subject iterable.
        nThreads - - the number of threads to use for concurrency
        closure - the procedure to apply on each element.

      • forEach

        public static <T> void forEach(java.lang.Iterable<? extends T> subjects,
                               int nThreads,
                               Procedure<? super T> closure)
        Concurrently applies the closure on each element of the given iterable. This method returns to the caller when the given closure is applied to all element, till then synchronously blocks. The number of executor threads is specified via the given nThreads parameter.

        Calling this method is similar to GPars' execution 

         GParsPool.withPool $availableProcessoros, { it ->
     //custom logic would go there
 }
        Parameters:
        subjects - the subject iterable.
        nThreads - - the number of threads to use for concurrency
        closure - the procedure to apply on each element.

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
